should work. maybe ou need to chroot and rebuilt initramfs ?

Ok I'll follow those instructions but do you think there is some way I could load my installed ubuntu. I'm getting a fatal error module not found error and the boot process just sits there. Can this be bypassed? Then I can modify the blacklist file through there.
the livecd has an option to boot a hard disk intall. dunno how well it works
Can you explain your procedure for using chroot and initramfs?

mount ubuntu install. then bind mount dev sys and proc « sudo mount -B /sys/ /mount/point/sys/ » « sudo mount -B /proc/ /mount/point/proc/ » « sudo mount -B /dev/ /mount/point/dev/ ». then chroot « sudo chroot /mount/point/ » and run the command « sudo update-initramfs -u »
Ok and once I have that done where will the /etc/modprobe.d folder be?
after the chrrot it will be in /etc/modprobe.d/
Aaaah ok I thought it was only dev sys and proc that were mounted?
